programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When District 21 goes after a Colombian drug gang following a series of brutal slayings, an asset in the investigation emerges.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Antonio believes a Colombian gang is involved in his son's kidnapping; Halstead learns new information about Lindsay; Voight offers Antonio a new way to get information about Diego's whereabouts.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Voight and the team check out a house that has been associated with a series of gangs; people from the past cause Halstead's temper to rise.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Olinsky tries to protect his daughter; a counterfeiting operation is investigated; when a hoarder is arrested, more than clutter is uncovered.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: While on a date, Nick is drugged by an unknown person and is framed for a bank robbery and a double murder. Now it is a race against time to clear his name, before he is sent to jail!

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Someone is trying to assassinate a club owner. Since he's a friend of Nick and Sylvie's, he asks the duo to check whether or not his biggest competitor has something to do with it.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Sylvie goes undercover to work at a telephone sex line company. One of the workers was murdered, and a potential suspect is calling the girls again.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A woman hires Nick and Sylvie to investigate what happened to her husband, who was recently found dead. She finds the sudden reappearance particularly suspicious... considering her husband has been dead for years.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick and Sylvie (Rob Stewart, Carolyn Dunn) uncover the murder of a teenage runaway who was the victim of a life insurance scam.

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Phil tries to max out a boat that propels itself using nothing but water and gravity.

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Phil conducts experiments that involve friction.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: In this episode we'll examine the life cycle of a butterfly and delve into the mechanics of how a bird is able to take flight. Plus, the mystery of how a Venus Flytrap catches its prey is revealed.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: In this episode, we find out how the Jaguar's spots create a disruptive pattern that makes them harder for prey to see. We'll also learn how a bee sting really works, and how a salmon is able to migrate thousands of miles to spawn.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Desolate landscapes as far as the eye can see, temperatures ranging from below freezing to 130 degrees and more. These are some of the most extreme environments in the entire Planet. This week, we head in to the desert.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Philippe explores the various ways our planet is always in motion. Visit the volcanic Mt. Saint Helens in Washington, where the movement of the earth's crust caused this mountain to erupt and create devastation in 1980. Plus, a look at oceans and waterways.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Two young people filming a documentary about a Hawaiian burial site are murdered; during the investigation, a drifter (Robert Englund) puts a curse on Danny.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: As the team investigates a grisly murder, evidence suggests the killer is about to strike again.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a zombielike man is shot, the team members are led to a madman who is performing experiments on humans.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: On Halloween, the team hunts a serial killer who mimics murders from a cult slasher film; Jerry is abducted by counterfeiters.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: On Halloween, the team tracks a serial killer inspired by an iconic character; a blood bank is raided by an armed gang.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: On Halloween, the team investigates the murder of a medium who was apparently frightened to death by a poltergeist; a mysterious death cult kidnaps Kono and Adam.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: At Halloween, the team investigates a string of murders that mirrors stories from well-known Hawaiian folklore; Grover visits a man who is hours away from execution and may hold the key to a case that has plagued Grover for years.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: On Halloween, Jerry and his friends search his childhood camp for evidence to a murder he witnessed as a boy; McGarrett investigates a little girl who drew pictures depicting the scene of a recent murder before it was discovered.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team investigates a home invasion that turned deadly after a dangerous "monster" escaped from the basement; Max returns to Oahu with a very special guest.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins go under cover as a couple on a romantic bus tour; a love bird on the trip is murdered and evidence is quickly deteriorating in the Hawaiian heat; TC is shaken when he runs into his ex-girlfriend.

programme.title: Magnum
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins take the case of recovering the stolen urn of a woman's deceased husband, but they soon find that others believe the urn is worth killing for; Rick and TC confront a man who's been impersonating football legend Andre Reed.

programme.title: Magnum
programme.desc: As their wedding day approaches, Magnum and Higgins help a modern-day Robin Hood who, thinking she was helping a school obtain needed supplies, unknowingly stole illicit drugs; Rick helps a retired soldier re-enter the workforce as a civilian.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins are each hired by two people who are in the middle of a contentious divorce to dig up dirt on the other; Rick and TC look into the death of an unidentified man and must share the news with his estranged daughter.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins help Rick when his father figure gets double-crossed; Magnum makes one last bold move to help Higgins stay in the country.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: New clients hire Magnum and Higgins to find their missing brother, which results in Higgins getting shot and TC abducted; Higgins and Magnum are surprised when her surgeon asks her out.

programme.title: Magnum
programme.desc: Higgins' job to repossess a plane goes south when a drug cartel opens fire at the plane, forcing her and Magnum to crash land in the jungle; Higgins has her first date with Dr. Ethan Shah.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick and Sylvie search for the truth behind the murder of a teenage runaway who was used as a decoy in a life insurance scam.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick is seriously injured on a case, leaving him unconscious in the hospital. Sylvie and Spider stay by his bedside, reminiscing about their experiences with him

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick is hired to find a little girl whose father took her from her mother and fled to Israel.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick and Sylvie go to work undercover, as a teacher & a clerical worker respectively, in a private school where a female student was murdered.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Angela and Brennan are caught in a melee at a hip-hop club, when a wall breaks open and reveals a mummified corpse and a stash of drugs.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and Booth race the clock to tie up loose ends before the defendant in Booth's first FBI case is executed for the crime.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A girl's decomposed remains are found in a refrigerator, leading Brennan to confront her former mentor.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: While trying to identify remains from the 1950s, Zack cuts into a bone and accidentally releases deadly fungus spores, causing the whole team to be quarantined in the lab over Christmas.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Rollins must revisit an old case when a child sent to juvenile detention is released after his 18th birthday.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Garland asks Benson to investigate an unusual domestic violence case when his neighbor is found injured.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: While Fin and Phoebe make wedding plans, Benson and Rollins try to help a homeless single mother who's being trafficked in exchange for safe housing.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: As the investigation into a sex-for-housing scheme expands, Benson's loyalty to Garland is tested; Rollins and Carisi try to keep their witnesses on board when a powerful congressman is identified as a suspect.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The search for a missing witness leads Fin and Kat down a dangerous path; Chief McGrath puts pressure on Garland and Benson to get a conviction.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Rollins must contend with the FBI and the Organized Crime bureau when a rape victim identifies a dangerous mobster as her assailant.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The SVU searches for a serial rapist who preys on mothers with young children; Benson and Fin struggle under the tightened reins of Chief McGrath.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The SVU faces the fury of social media fans when they arrest two popular influencer brothers.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Amaro asks the SVU for help in clearing a convicted man's name and brings a figure from Benson's past back into her life.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When a teenage sex worker disappears, Rollins and Velasco find a key clue in a pile of neglected missing persons reports.

programme.title: I Survived a Crime
programme.desc: A man risks his life to safe his wife during a home invasion; two convenience store workers defend their workplace; a hairdresser is put in an unpredictable situation.

programme.title: I Survived a Crime
programme.desc: A typical Sunday morphs into a gunfight when two armed men invade a family's home; an unsuspecting impound lot worker checks out a disturbance and is nearly mowed down by an irate woman in a two-ton truck; a car owner tries to stop a carjacking.

programme.title: I Survived a Crime
programme.desc: A motorcyclist is bumped off his bike by an angry motorist; a bartender is choked by her enraged boss; a serial convenience store thief makes peace with the irate owner he stole from.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.desc: Cloning and gene editing might offer a lifeline to species struggling to survive on a planet severely altered by human activities and climate change. Some conservationists now ask: Is nature's 3.6 billion-year-old code of life in need of a reboot?

programme.title: Journey Into Another World
programme.desc: Join the OSIRIS-REx mission to land on an asteroid, collect a sample and return to earth.

programme.title: In Real Life
programme.desc: Correspondent Soledad O'Brien shows the battle to reach Latino voters over radio, as both progressives and conservatives vie for political influence on the airwaves.

programme.title: In Real Life
programme.desc: As the U.S. bolsters its position against China, some communities across island territories and allies are pushing back on an American military buildup.

programme.title: Scripps News Showcase
programme.desc: Farmer Marty Travis watches his land and community fall victim to the pressures of agribusiness. Determined to create a proud legacy for his son, Marty transforms his profitless wasteland and pioneers the sustainable food movement in Chicago.

programme.title: Home Sweet Home
programme.desc: Fall is a great time to evaluate your home needs, from renovations, to buying for the first time, or even sizing up or down for your family. Scripps News will tackle the housing market with viewers to help them make the best decision.

programme.title: Scripps News Investigates
programme.desc: Scripps News Investigates shines a light on abuse of power, corruption, and injustice through cutting-edge data analysis and human-centered storytelling.

programme.desc: Packers quarterback Jordan Love, who went 23 of 31 for 214 yards with three touchdowns and two interceptions. Packers K Brandon McManus' game-winning kick represented the latest chapter in an eventful year for him.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Quarterback Lamar Jackson led the Balitmore Ravens back from Tampa Bay Buccaneers' double-deficit lead on his way to accounting for 5 touchdowns of his own.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Steelers QB Russell Wilson threw for two touchdowns and ran for another score. He completed 16 of 29 passes for 264 yards, shaking off some early rust and ignoring the boos and brief chants for Fields when the offense sputtered in the first half. An 11-yard lob to George Pickens for a touchdown late in the first half allowed Wilson to exhale.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Boston waited 86 years for the Red Sox to break the "Curse of the Bambino" and end its World Series title drought in 2004. It took just three years for the team to win another.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Brad Lidge closed out the Rays and a perfect season as Harry Kalas declared "The Philadelphia Phillies are 2008 World Champions of baseball".

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: In a historic victory, the Yankees secure their 27th World Series title, propelled by Hideki Matsui's legendary performance. His six runs driven in, a World Series record, almost single handedly beat the Phillies, propelling New York to a 7-3 win.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The Giants defeat the Rangers to win their first World Series championship since 1954.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 2011 matchup between the Cardinals and the Rangers. After being down to their last out twice in Game 6, St. Louis walked it off in extras and went on to win Game 7, securing the team's 11th World Series championship.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The San Francisco Giants swept Justin Verlander, Miguel Cabrera and the Detroit Tigers to win their second World Series championship in three seasons.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The Boston Red Sox dispatch the St. Louis Cardinals in six games to earn their third World Series championship in 10 seasons.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: "Twins clinch their first World Series title, after key pitching from Frank Viola.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 2014 matchup between the Giants and the Royals. With the series tied at 3-3, Madison Bumgarner twirled five stellar innings on two days rest in Game 7 to propel San Francisco to their third World Series in five years.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Josh Beckett throws a complete game shutout to help the Marlins win their second championship

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Andy Pettitte has a strong outing in a 5-2 Game 6 win over the Angels in the ALCS

programme.desc: Look back at some top walk-offs, including the Rays' wild rally in Game 162 and more.

programme.desc: Watch some of the best streaks in MLB history, from Joe DiMaggio's hit streak reaching 56 to the A's winning 20 straight games.

programme.title: Epic Innings
programme.desc: Look back at classic game endings including Joe Carter's three-run homer in the 1993 World Series and more.

programme.desc: Spotlighting the careers and moments of top Canadian players like Larry Walker, Joey Votto and more.

programme.desc: Ted Williams, Mickey Mantle, and Gil Hodges highlight the Prime 9 All 1950's Team.

programme.title: Prime 9
programme.desc: Willie Mays, Hank Aaron, and Maury Wills highlight the Prime 9 All 1960's Team.

programme.title: Prime 9
programme.desc: Mike Schmidt, Joe Morgan and Steve Garvey highlight the Prime 9 All 1970's Team.

programme.title: Prime 9
programme.desc: Rickey Henderson, Mike Schmidt, and Don Mattingly highlight the Prime 9 All 1980's Team.

programme.title: Prime 9
programme.desc: Barry Bonds, Greg Maddux, and Ken Griffey Jr. highlight the Prime 9 All 1990's Team.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1960 matchup between the Pirates and the Yankees. Entering the bottom of the 9th inning of Game 7 tied at 9, Pirates second baseman Bill Mazeroski smashed a walk-off home run to crown the team as World Series champions

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The Yankees and Giants are no strangers to World Series face-offs, but in 1962 the former cross-town rivals met in the Postseason for the first time since the Giants' move to San Francisco.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The 1964 World Series Film highlights Bob Gibon's complete-game effort against the Yankees

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1965 matchup between the Dodgers and the Twins. With Los Angeles and Minnesota tied at 3 games apiece, Hall of Famer Sandy Koufax twirled a stellar three-hit shutout to lift the Dodgers to their 4th World Series title

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Roberto Clemente leads the Pirates to their 4th World Series championship against the Orioles.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The Oakland A's, in search of the franchise's first World Series Championship since 1930, outlasted Cincinnati's "Big Red Machine" in a seven game series that featured six contests that were decided by only one run.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1973 matchup between the Athletics and the Mets. Down in the series, Oakland rallied back behind solid pitching to clinch their second straight World Series victory.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1975 matchup between the Reds and the Red Sox. After trailing 3-0 in Game 7, Cincinnati battled back to take the lead in the 9th and capture their first World Series of the decade, giving birth to the "Big Red Machine"

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Jim Leyland steered the Marlins to their first ever franchise World Series win against Cleveland, a series that lasted seven games in 1997. Edgar Renteria hit the walk-off single in the 11th inning which plated Craig Counsell securing the conquest.

programme.title: Baseball's Seasons
programme.desc: Interleague play is introduced for the first time as part of the regular season. The year is highlighted by Ken Griffey Jr.'s AL MVP performance and the Florida Marlins becoming the first Wild Card team to win a World Series.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1997 matchup between the Marlins and the Indians. A back and forth series between Florida and Cleveland, the Marlins walked it off in the 11th inning of Game 7 to give the team its first World Series championship.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Having set a modern-day record for most wins in the regular season, the Yankees faced the Padres and established themselves as one of the best teams to ever put on the Pinstripes.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: The guys uncover a cop car racing series around the Ford Crown Victoria P71 Police Interceptor; with a handful of bolt-on upgrades, they turn their former police auction find into a road race ripper around Willow Springs.

programme.title: Runs Good
programme.desc: The team takes a short train ride to Santa Fe, New Mexico, to look at a Chevy Silverado 2500 that has an LS transplant; the previous owner wanted to turn it into a Sunday cruiser, but couldn't sort out why it would randomly shift into neutral.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A '57 Chevy looks great, but the guys discover that looks can be deceiving.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: This year's over-the-top build has Bill and crew lifting a 2020 Chevy Silverado 5500 more than a foot with a custom heavy-duty air suspension; the guys also prove their Texas mettle by radically overhauling the utility bed.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: Team Unique puts the full-court press on basketball superstar Carmelo Anthony's Jeep Wrangler; Will forges a path to build his company's future.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A past client returns with a 1965 Mustang Fastback, and though he likes the stock look, he wants to upgrade the drivetrain, instrumentation and as many modern amenities as possible; the assembly team gets a crash course in engine tuning.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: An active-duty serviceman and his father are finally ready to finish their 1951 Ford pickup.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The Martins face the challenge of trying to fit a 6'5" former football player into the cab of a 1967 Chevy C10, requiring customization of the firewall, motor, frame and interior.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill and his team make one of their longest custom chassis ever for a new 2020 Denali, and Ekstensive gets a diesel pro-mod drag car back on the track.

programme.title: Dirt Every Day
programme.desc: The guys are on the hunt for Colorado's finest four-wheeling trails.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kev take the show to the Midwest, as more than 2,500 cars descend on the Summit Motorsports drag strip for a weekend of fun; Kev gets a ride in a lean, mean drag racing machine; Dave steps up his autocross game.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: With updates well underway on custom car guru Joe Martin's prized '65 Pontiac Catalina, Joe and the boys at Martin Bros. Customs give the ol' choppy-doo to a '41 DeSoto that has seen better days.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Truck builds tend to get bigger than originally planned, so it's no surprise when a 1971 Suburban goes even bigger with a custom lifted air suspension and interior; a nearly finished 2006 Kodiak needs just one more custom upgrade.

programme.desc: A simple yet classy Pontiac Tempest arrives for a ground-up build, but things get complicated after the car is completely stripped.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The 1971 240Z rust bucket known as Rotsun has never failed to fail; David and Mike want to get it back up and running after years of neglect and drive it to SEMA.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Cougar and the gear-banging are back, but the car now belongs to Steve Dulcich, and the guys are jerking the haggard Cleveland in favor of a 450hp, 363ci, Windsor-based stroker small-block.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David and Steve have a great time fixing the Crusher Impala and testing it with 100-yard burnouts.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Newbern surprises Cotten and Finnegan with a visit to the sacred grounds of Dennis Anderson's Digger's Dungeon; the guys rebuild a busted-up mega truck and take on Finnegan's childhood idol in a race against the creator of Grave Digger himself.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys try to determine whether a leaf blower can supercharge an engine and make power, starting with a 1978 Monza Spyder with a 305 V8 and a four-speed stick.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: A tank squashes a Prius; a shootout between a Toyota Prius hybrid and a '75 AMC Gremlin is all fun and games until the Prius engine goes up in flames.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan have big fun with retro trail motorcycles on their way to reviving a long-neglected HOT ROD magazine project vehicle, a 1974 Chevy shortbed stepside beater, and road-tripping it to the eighth-mile drags.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike cross a rusted 1971 Datsun 240Z with a Chevy 4.3L V6 and a turbo from a Ford Power Stroke Diesel to create the Rotsun; the guys expect the revived Rotsun to dominate in a nine-car autocross showdown.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan rebuild a 1968 Dodge Charger using motor home parts; vehicles making cameo appearances include the Macho Grande, the 1966 Buick Special convertible, the ramp truck and the Fury.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich beat on David's '99 Dodge Ram and Steve's '73 Chevy.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The legendary '68 Dodge Charger General Mayhem gets stripped of its 707-hp Hellcat engine and all the related electronics; Freiburger and Dulcich vow to take it from the dragstrip setup back to its motorhome 440-powered V8 and gravel-chucking roots.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Sam Strube helps finish the 1931 Model A F-Rod and takes it to the track.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The guys put John Andrade Jr. in a tiny truck and beat him in a mud drag race with the Dirt Track Camaro; Andrade challenges them to see what they can do with a derelict and parted-out Mustang against his 79 Chevy Malibu.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys attempt to check off the final five states Freiburger needs to hit all 50 by taking their junkyard T-37 across New England; the T-37 hits the road, and the road hits back before the guys leave their mark in New York City.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich troubleshoot transmission issues and more in the 1969 Chevy Impala that's powered by a supercharged 498ci big-block V8, then take it back to the track to see if they can finally get their 10-second time slip.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Finnegan, Newbern and Cotten do some wheelie R&D to find out what it takes to put a 1978 GMC Class C motorhome's tires in the air; with the help of pro wheelstander Mike Mantel, the guys take on the challenge of making dreams become reality.

programme.title: Doubles Poker Championship
programme.desc: Thirty-two of the best professional poker players in the world buy in for $50,000 apiece, but there's a twist. They are then randomly paired off and compete as two-person teams that share the play on each hand. With $1 million in first place prize money at stake, which team will survive the gauntlet of clashing personalities and top shelf competition in a game that's usually a single-minded endeavor?

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $5,000 Seven Card Stud World Championship attracted 144 entrants and created a prize pool of $676,800. The WSOP bracelet and $221,000 first-place prize would look to be claimed by a savvy group of final tablists that included Marcel Luske, Jeff Lisandro, Joe Awada, Cory Zeidman, Dewey Tomko and John Juanda.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Phil Hellmuth headlines the $3,000 Pot-Limit Hold'em final table that includes Ram Vaswani and Phi Nguyen, while Gavin Griffin chases the title of youngest WSOP bracelet of all-time if he can emerge victorious. Who will win the $270,420 first-place prize and prestigious WSOP bracelet?

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The only straight Razz tournament of the 2004 WSOP would see a field of 195 players. Chris Bjorin, Hoyt Corkins, John Juanda, Howard Lederer, and Dutch Boyd all look to deny T.J. Cloutier his fifth WSOP bracelet as all eyes are on the $90,500 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: T.J. Cloutier entered the final table of the $5,000 Limit Hold'em eyeing his second WSOP bracelet of the series in just as many days. However, he would have John Hennigan, An Tran, and David Chiu to content with for the $325,360 first-place prize and WSOP bracelet.

programme.title: FRIDAY NIGHT POKER
programme.desc: "Watch a replay of the sixth Friday Night Poker cash game! Kelly Minkin, Bryan Piccioli, Marle Cordeiro, Lilou Agostini, Frank Kassela, and Justin Young headline an spooky $5/$10 cash game. Jeff Platt, Brent Hanks, and Amanda Leatherman call the action, with a guest appearance from Daniel Negreanu!"

programme.title: FRIDAY NIGHT POKER
programme.desc: "Watch a replay of the seventh Friday Night Poker cash game! Chris Moorman, Dan Shak, Randall Emmett, Jon Turner, Hish Salama, Frank Kassela, and Marle Cordeiro a high-flying $5/$10 cash game. Jeff Platt, Brent Hanks, and Amanda Leatherman call the action!"

programme.title: FRIDAY NIGHT POKER
programme.desc: "Watch a replay of the seventh Friday Night Poker cash game! Phil Hellmuth, Jennifer Tilly, Rob Iler, Mark Birnbaum, Jay Farber, Frank Kassela, and Maggio Cipriani in an exciting $5/$10 cash game. Jeff Platt, Brent Hanks, and Amanda Leatherman call the action!"

programme.title: Super High Roller Bowl Celebrity Shootout
programme.desc: It's a clash of worlds as five celebrities compete for a chance to play one of poker's all-time best for $1 million in the Super High Roller Celebrity Shootout.

programme.title: Super High Roller Bowl Celebrity Shootout
programme.desc: The celebrity table of the Super High Roller Celebrity Shootout is heating up and getting louder. Brad Garrett and Don Cheadle trade blows while Hank Azaria takes the chip lead.

programme.title: Super High Roller Bowl Celebrity Shootout
programme.desc: The celebrity table of the Super High Roller Celebrity Shootout is down to four but only one will advance to play the pros heads up for $1 million.

programme.title: Super High Roller Bowl Celebrity Shootout
programme.desc: Kevin Pollak beat the celebs and now the professionals take center stage. Phil Hellmuth Daniel Negreanu and Doyle Brunson headline the other half of the Super High Roller Celebrity Shootout.

programme.title: Super High Roller Bowl Celebrity Shootout

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit is to Acqua Beach in Weymouth, where Charlotte Weaver and best friend Lucy Falkingham hope their quirky design and decor makes them stand out from the crowd.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to Langmead Guest House in Ramsgate, where owners Derek and Lynne Love are all about keeping it simple.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to The Big Green Bus in Lewes, where carpenter Adam Collier-Woods and his girlfriend Susan Lerski run an unconventional B&B on a converted double decker bus.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to The Pheasant in Brill, where professional chef Stephen Orr hopes his top level place will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to the Miners Arms in Nenthead, Cumbria, where sisters Alison Baker and Lynda Clark hope to impress their guests with their eco credentials.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Brothers Andrew and James Widdas run the Rose and Crown in Edgworth, near Bolton. Their dream is to provide boutique on a budget, but they only have eight months of experience, and B&B veterans Alison and Lynda are quick to find fault.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Nigel and Pok U Regan cultivate an east-meets-west atmosphere at their B&B and Cantonese restaurant, the Bingham Townhouse in Nottinghamshire.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Float by Boat, near Rugby, partners Kev Argent and Tor Johnson run mediation and mindfulness breaks from their narrowboat, Spirited Away.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Filey, North Yorkshire, at The White Lodge Hotel, where hosts James and Kim Hodgson hope their love of luxury and high standards will win over their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Crystals on The Prom in Blackpool, where Amanda Lucia-Charley, joined by friend Alan Talbot, hopes her unique and theatrical design decisions will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's third visit is to The Red Lion Country Inn in Upper Poppleton, North Yorkshire, where practical pair Mark and Jean Lee hope their plain and simple pub B&B will impress their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Finishing off the competition is glamping site Camp Katur in Kirklington, where Kerry Roy and Nicola Wilding hope to wow the guests with their unique `geodomes' and see through pods.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at The Farmyard Inn in Youlgrave, in the Peak District, where manager Susan Day is joined by her best friend Andrea Scott.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Stoneleigh B&B in Trowbridge, where ex-teachers Meg and Andy Slade invite the guests into their family home.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit, the competition heads to Whittlesey, Peterborough, and The Falcon Hotel, where Colin and Michelle Wilson hope their no frills pub will impress.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Finishing off the competition is Grimscote Manor Hotel in Birmingham, owned by business partners Steve Cuddy and Gill Etheridge, who aim to bring elegant sophistication to the hospitality trade.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at The Cholmeley Arms in Burton-le-Coggles, Lincolnshire, run by chef John Berry and his wife Lesley.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Islington Mill B&B in Salford, where Joe Spencer and Louise Woodcock have an alternative hosting style as their drag alter egos: Joyce De Vision and Trish Dee.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit this week is to Pebbles B&B in Seaton, Devon, where host Peter Morris opened his family home to guests eight months ago.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to the Tarr Farm Inn on Exmoor, where Hilary Lester rules the roost with assistant manager Stacey Wade.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit is to the Bridge Hotel in Scunthorpe with new owners Martin and Hannah Weaver. On arrival, Rob and Michelle Earp from Seashells B&B in Sutton-on-Sea find a condom by the entrance, and Clare Davies and Fran Hancock from The New Court Hotel in Usk have concerns over interior cleanliness. Tom Jones and Samara Cohen from The Crown at Whitchurch judge the rooms to be little more than functional.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The group stay at Sue's dog friendly Seashells Guesthouse in Great Yarmouth no one knows quite what to expect.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to East Linton in Scotland and the Crown and Kitchen.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The New Court Hotel in Usk, where manager Clare Davies is joined in the competition by the pub owner's mother, Fran Hancock. On arrival, Tom and Samara are impressed, but Martin and Hannah find lots of cleanliness issues. At dinner, there are tensions as the group discuss who would take which role if they were to run a B&B together. Breakfast is cooked by Clare, but peppery eggs and missing mushrooms cause concern.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at The Admiral Hotel in central London, run by owner So Shaw and hotel manager Kevin Jankunas.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to The Redstone in Blackpool, where high-end hotelier Ursula Beswick and manager Daria Pakalnicka hope their luxury guest house will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition continues at Ann's Farmhouse in Thornton, Yorkshire, owned by Chris Foster, who's assisted by his good friend, Christel Richter.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The R Inn in Desborough, owned by Kris Malde, who's helped out by events manager Vikki Cheetham.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Stockton Mill B&B in Shropshire, where Stephen and Caroline Cox hope to provide a home from home for their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Duxford Lodge in Cambridgeshire, run by ex-phone salesman Kevin Patel. He's hoping to turn his family-owned hotel into a 1940s inspired B&B.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to The Riverside House Hotel in Mildenhall, where experienced hoteliers Ged Sharrocks and Suzanne Law offer a full hotel experience helped by their staff.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Last to host are Stacey Walsham and Gemma Dyche from The Gate Hangs High in Hook Norton, Oxfordshire, where they hope their dog-friendly accommodation will go down a treat.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Hampshire, at The Poacher Inn, where manager Nadia Schicci hopes her Italian directness and business approach will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Forest Country House in Powys, Wales, where owner Paul Martin, joined by best friend and neighbour, Jayne Kirk, hopes his luxury BandB will impress his guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit the group head to Fenwick, Scotland and Langside Bed and Breakfast, where high rolling, super clean hosts Debbie and Jim hope their business will wow the crowd.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the historic The Tushielaw Inn in Selkirk, Scotland, opened by Rab and Gail Forbes six months ago. Gail and Rab try to build bridges, but things take a downward turn.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Rooms 36 in The Lake District, owned by health-conscious Andy Peters, who is joined by friend and fellow B&B owner, Jeronime Palmer.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second hosts of the week are mother and son team Trish and Connor Richardson from the Red Lion Coaching Inn near Gainsborough.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Schiehallion Hotel in Aberfeldy, run by Julie Dunbar and James Graham. Some guests are impressed, but luxury lovers Andy and Jeronime are left wanting more.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to Townhead Hotel in Lockerbie, owned by Stephen Montgomery and partner Jan. On arrival, the high level of finish in the rooms is a surprise for all of the guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In Stratford upon Avon at The Water's Edge Guest House, owner Julie Allison and friend Gerry Crabtree hope their luxurious approach and themed rooms will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the Kilpeck Inn in Herefordshire where head chef Ross Williams and front of house manager Kath Capel consider no detail too small.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third stop is The Fox Inn in Guisborough where young hosts Michael Crane and Jai Bennison are determined to impress their guests with their straight-forward northern B&B.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Ivanhoe Guest House, Bridlington, Mick and Gill Jennings think their simple approach will win the day. But at breakfast some serious allegations are made about the food.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Falmouth in Cornwall, where Gaye Woods, owner of Meudon Hotel, hopes her family run hotel will win the day, but are her room rates too high?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Malborough in Devon and The Royal Oak pub, run by Tim Heap with help from his barman Mikey Martindale. Following some unwanted extras at breakfast, feedback is tough.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is in Tiverton in Devon and The Angel Guest House where owners Chris and Sue Holliday have created a homespun experience, but will they prove too competitive for the guests?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit is The Compton Swan in Newbury, owned by Geoff Jones and Joan McGowan. Expectations are high after Joan reveals she was named Ireland's Business Woman of the Year.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Brighton Surf Hotel, Jeremy Mann and his Russian wife Elena hope their hands-off hosting style will win the day, despite the lack of breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Number 16, in Greenwich, London. Owner Robert Gray, an actor and antiques dealer, charms with his hosting, but Jan and Les find the dusty decor off-putting.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Fleur de Lis in Sandwich in Kent, hosts Jan and Les Fisher are convinced that their traditional place will impress their guests, but Robert is bent on revenge.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to The Barn at Dale End House near Matlock in the Peak District, owned by Sarah Summers. Sarah is dreading Robert's arrival, but all the guests are bowled over.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Starting in Betws-y-coed, North Wales, where at Llwyn Onn Guest House, bikers Wayne and Tracy Dunn hope their no-nonsense attitude will win the competition.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Parkwood Hotel in Stockton on Tees, where newlywed managers Jon and Chelli Bean are all about making things perfect for pooches.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Great Glen in Leicestershire and The Pug and Greyhound, where Nicola Ellershaw and her colleague, Mackenzie Griffey, hope their super-stylish accommodation will dazzle.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Solar Strand Hotel in Crosskeys, Wales, where former IT consultant Gary Pesticcio and his daughter, Naomi, hope their high-tech B&B will power them to victory.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at The Shoes, Durham, where landlord Billy Gowland and partner Debbie Nelson hope their footwear-themed pub BandB is the right fit for their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Biggin Hall Hotel in Derbyshire, where owner James Moffat and partner Annie Larner hope the BandBers will fall for the rural charm of their 17th-century farmhouse.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit the group head to yurt glamp-site, Forest Garden Shovelstrode in East Sussex, where hosts Charles and Lisa Hooper hope the BandBers buy into their woodland retreat.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Derby Manor Hotel and Restaurant run by mother and son team Fiona and James Milligan who opened their doors eight months ago after a million pound refurbishment.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Hope Mountain in North Wales, where husband and wife team, Rob and Jo Smith hope their dog-friendly B&B will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Beaumont Hotel in Louth, near Lincoln, where managers and best friends, Steffi Stevenson and Sarah Banks, pride themselves on being the `queens of clean'.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Rock House Hotel in Lynmouth, Devon, where owner Emilio Tundidor is assisted by his identical twin brother Fernando.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Troy House in Painswick, where owners Alan and Denise Newman hope their guests will fall in love with their rooms.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Flying the flag on day two are Norfolk couple Jenny and Richard Harmer, from Chimneys B&B in North Walsham.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Copperfields Guest House in Broadstairs, Kent, where owners Neale and Julie Taylor hope their exclusively vegetarian B&B will stand out from the crowd.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week the group head to The George and Abbotsford in Melrose, Scotland, where host Andrea Gardner and front of house manager John Marr pull out all the stops.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Massimo's in Seaham, County Durham, where Italian chef Massimo Perrulli is joined by his cousin, Raf, on front of house. Emotions run riot as things come to a head.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This competition kicks off in Malvern, Worcestershire where retired pro-rugby player Steve Lloyd and partner Kathy Leather open their Copper Beech House to fellow B&B owners.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the pet friendly Dog in a Doublet pub and restaurant in Peterborough where Della McGinn's passion for animals comes a close second to husband John's passion for food.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week, the B&Bers head to the Torcroft Boutique B&B in Torquay, Devon, where Europhiles Phil and Sharon Hobson hope their added extras will win over their rivals.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the 600-year-old Rhydspence Inn in Herefordshire, owned by Mark and Lowrie Price. All guests are charmed by the medieval inn, but there's still underlying tension.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This time the 'Dodgeball Men' are back to make 'The Qualifier' game an even bigger challenge for contestants.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, twenty intrepid contestants take on four gruelling obstacles.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Twenty contestants take on one of television's largest and most extreme obstacle courses.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Its no doubt that the Ball Crusher Sweeper is the star of tonights show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this weeks Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard Hammond hosts another episode of TV's stupidest, brightest and most insane game show.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: You will see how ten celebrities compete and risk everything in the name of charity.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, twenty intrepid contestants take on four gruelling, but wildly funny obstacle courses.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the last episode of the season and the 7 previous winners compete to be the Champion of Champions.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns dont come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of violent love, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This week they have added two new obstacles to 'The Qualifier' game.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: The first Total Wipeout awards as they celebrate the highs and lows of the whole season.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: It's all kicking off in Buenos Aires - again!

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: 20 fabulous contestants travel halfway across the globe to the purpose-built course in Buenos Aires.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. Its all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. Nat with the Tats and Renee Lets get physical move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. Its a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the last episode of the season and the 8 previous winners compete to be the Champion of Champions.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Dirty Balls, The Donut Swing, The Toothbrush Bristles, Tippy Tables and Dock Maze are among some of the over-the-top obstacles included in this weeks episode.

programme.desc: This week they have added a new obstacle called 'The Dreadmill'.

programme.title: Ramsay's Best Restaurant
programme.desc: S01:E02 - Indian

programme.title: Ramsay's Best Restaurant
programme.desc: S01:E03 - Chinese

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
In tonight's final programme Gordon returns to Momma Cherri's Soul Food Shack, an intimate forty-seater in Brighton where he oversaw one of the most spectacular changes of fortune at a single venue. Owner CHARITA JONES was producing a menu of irresistible unique classics from the Deep South, but at the same facing financial disaster. The punters were missing, and so was her business acumen. But Gordon succeeded in shutting her out of the kitchen, getting the chef back on the boil and putting the soul back into the business.
Today Charita is fully-booked round the clock and bursting out of the Soul Shack to take on the 110-seater Momma Cherri's Big House. But expansion brings a different set of challenges, and she's still struggling to control her staff and manage her success. Has she got what it takes to make the next step up, or will she be forced to rethink her grand plans?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's penultimate programme Gordon returns to La Riviera - now renamed Abstract - a fine dining restaurant in Inverness. Owned by multi-millionaire Barry Larson and costing ~8000 a week to run, the place boasted top French chef Loic Lefebvre and an impeccably-trained kitchen staff, all of them on a mission to bring sophisticated French cooking to the home of the haggis. But the locals weren't biting and the restaurant was empty most nights. Gordon's recipe for survival forced them to tone down their act and demystify the menu to get the punters in. Today the restaurant's return to form has led to plans for expansion. Loic is still there, and now he's been promoted to Executive Chef he will oversee any new ventures. But can he continue to resist a return to French frills, and has he managed to pull off his own personal ambition, a Michelin star?

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S05:E02 - Episode 2

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S05:E03 - Episode 3

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Tonight, for the first time ever on Kitchen Nightmares, Gordon takes on a nightmare restaurant abroad. La Parra de Burriana is an ex-pat restaurant in Nerja on Spain's Costa del Sol. Nestling among the cafes lining the seafront offering all-day English breakfast and chips, La Parra is the brainchild of twenty-six-year-old ex-nightclub manager Laurence. He set himself up in business eighteen months ago with a loan from his dad and, although he's not an experienced chef, mans the kitchen on his own, determined to offer something better than chips to his largely British clientele.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's second programme Gordon tackles a pub for the first time, getting to grips with The Fenwick Arms in rural Lancashire. The pub is run by landlord Brian who, after thirty years in the business and a quadruple heart-bypass, still puts in 120 hours a week and insists on laying down the law in the kitchen. Despite their best endeavours Brian and his partner Elaine are ~250k in debt, losing ~1500 a week and facing bankruptcy within three months unless there's a drastic reversal in their fortunes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining central region chefs do battle for a place in the national finals. They must impress the formidable panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton with their four-course menus.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Andrew is attempting to pay tribute to NHS staff with his take on a traditional healing recipe, `Mum's Flu-Fighting Chicken Soup'. Jason's `A Tea From The Heart' is a play on a post-war remedy which harks back to the era when the NHS was formed.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After the starter results, the chefs return to the kitchen hoping for high scores with their fish dishes. Chris once again is using ingredients he has foraged from around his restaurant, while Jason hopes to impress with a spicy scallop dish and Andrew prepares a cod dish with 11 different elements.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs are pulling out all the stops in a bid for big scores with their mains. All three dishes pay tribute to the founder of the NHS Aneurin Bevan, Chris's `Everything But The Squeal' is an ambitious pork sharing platter, while Jason's `For The Rich And The Poor' showcases lamb, and Andrew is hoping to impress with `Aneurin Bevan For Better Steak'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the dessert course and the last opportunity for the chefs to impress. Chris is hoping to triumph with another dish which showcases the foraged ingredients available around his restaurant, while Jason attempts a technical feat in his dessert inspired by a childhood hospital stay and Andrew is inspired by a dish by his great grandmother used to cook. Which two will make it through to the judging chamber?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the Wales regional final as the two remaining chefs do everything they can to impress the judging panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. After tensions ran high in the week, the chefs are under pressure to deliver perfection. The judges are joined by Aneira Thomas, the first baby born on the NHS, who is named in tribute to the service's founder Aneurin Bevan and who went on to dedicate her life to the service. Who will win a place in the national finals?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the turn of three chefs representing the south west, including two who have competed before but meet in the kitchen this week for the very first time. The chefs meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their celebratory starters.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course and with Tom renowned as a fish specialist all eyes are on him. He's cooking his take on a classic British fish supper in tribute to a charity which looks after the health of local fishermen. Jude is attempting a complex fusion dish featuring four different fish and an unusual X Ray themed presentation, while Olivia is paying tribute to the staff who looked after her during the birth of her first son with her take on curried monkfish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the main course and two of the chefs are hoping duck will win the day. Tom is preparing a technically challenging duck dish steeped in NHS history while Jude is making a multi-element Chinese duck dish inspired by his mum. Olivia is hoping her dish, using two unusual cuts of beef, will score top points. Olivia also visits her local children's hospital, home of the second busiest paediatric A&E in the country.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With just one more chance to impress their veteran judge, the chefs are all hoping to use their pastry skills to deliver technically complex desserts. Tom's cooking an `Invalid Fruit Tart' inspired by a 1950s recipe, while Jude is making six different apple elements for his `An Apple A Day'. Olivia is using stout in reference to an outdated old wives' tale which suggested the drink was a healthy source of iron during pregnancy.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's time for the two remaining chefs representing the South West to go head to head as they cook their menus again for the exacting panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. With a spot in the National Finals at stake, both are aiming for perfection as they bid for glory. The judges are joined by Barbara Childs, a Matron in the Cardiac Intensive Care Unit at Great Ormond Street Hospital, who isn't afraid to speak her mind in the chamber.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three chefs take to the kitchen in a bid to represent the north west in the national final. They include Ellis Barrie, from the award winning Marram Grass in Anglesey, Liam Simpson-Trotman, an accomplished pastry chef and co-owner of the 4 AA rosette Orwell's in Oxfordshire, and Craig Sherrington, who sharpened his skills working under top names including Eric Chavot and is now Chef Patron of Virginia House in Cumbria.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course and the chefs are all gunning for tens. Craig pays tribute to a friend who has revolutionised hospital food in Morecambe Bay, while Liam is inspired by health advice his grandma gave him and Ellis is dedicating his dish to the staff who delivered his son Albert. With cod, mackerel, shrimp and cockles on the menu, which of the chefs will score highly?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Time for the chefs to cook their mains and the pressure is on. Craig is hoping to impress using two cuts of Dexter beef, while Liam prepares his take on a Bajan lamb stew and Ellis prepares four cuts of suckling pig. Liam meets his personal hero, Nola Ishmael OBE, who became the UK's first ever black Director of Nursing.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the last chance for the North West chefs to impress in a bid to make it through to the regional final. Liam is cooking `Not So Hot Toddy' in honour of a friend who works nightshifts in the NHS, while Ellis' `Worth Their Weight in Gold' is dedicated to the staff who saved his brother's life and Craig's dish `The Missed Celebration' pays tribute to his wife with an unusual Christmas concept.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two highest scoring chefs from the week return to cook their menus again. Judging them are Matthew Fort, Oliver Peyton and Andi Oliver who are joined by Dr Jake Dunning MBE, an infectious disease specialist who has been recognised for his work during the West Africa Ebola epidemic.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three chefs are doing battle to represent Northern Ireland. Tommy Heaney, Head Chef at the Great House Hotel in South Wales is taken on by Shauna Froydenlund, Chef Patron at Marcus Wareing's two Michelin starred restaurant and James Devine, the 2017 National Chef of the Year.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After a tense starter course, the chefs return to the kitchen to cook their fish dishes. James is making his elevated take on a fried chicken takeaway as a tribute to the NHS staff who care for his sister. Shauna is also taking inspiration from a personal connection with a tribute to staff from a facility in her hometown of Londonderry. Tommy is hoping to impress with a dish dedicated to the discovery of DNA.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With two courses down it's time for the chefs to cook their main courses. It's the battle of beef with each using the same meat in their innovative creations. Tommy also meets the first baby ever born on the NHS.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the final chance for the chefs to impress. After such a tightly fought battle all week, each is hoping to deliver a technically perfect dessert. Tommy and James are both using passion fruit in their complex dishes while Shauna is hoping to use her pastry chef training to score full marks.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs representing Northern Ireland go head to head. Judging as ever are Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver who are joined by Shehan Hettiaratchy, lead trauma surgeon at St Mary's Hospital who helped treat victims of the Grenfell Tower fire.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The winning chefs from all eight regions must battle it out for the honour of a spot on 2018's `Feast To Say Thank You' banquet menu, celebrating 70 years of the NHS, one of Britain's most prized institutions.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs must cook their fish courses but after some exceptionally high-scoring dishes in the starter round, everyone is desperate to deliver perfection. Once again the chefs present their innovative, witty or heart-warming creations.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's main course day and with only two spots remaining on the banquet menu, the competition is fierce. Both chefs and judges alike are amazed at the high standard of cooking and an incredible number of 10s are dished out as the chefs serve up venison, rabbit, duck, beef, lamb and pork for scrutiny.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's dessert day and with just one place remaining at the banquet feast, each chef is giving everything they've got for a chance to say thank you to the heroic NHS staff. All the chefs have significantly re-worked or re-invented their desserts since the regional heats, proving that they'll do everything they can in a bid for that final winning spot.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the grand finale as the winning chefs cook their dishes at a banquet for the heroes of the NHS. Having arrived at St Bartholomew's Hospital, the chefs are shown the incredible location for event, the almost three-hundred-year-old Great Hall.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Some of the nation's greatest chefs battle for the chance to cook a glittering Olympic banquet. The feast will honour the hopes and achievements of the country's sporting heroes, and it will be a glorious celebration of Britain's culinary talents. This time it is the battle of the Scottish chefs - returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway.

programme.title: Great British Menu

Great British Menu veteran Jeremy Lee will decide who goes through to the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is decision time for the chefs from Scotland. The two remaining chefs cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu' judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges aren't easily pleased and only world class cooking will do. Only one chef can make it through to the national finals to represent Scotland. If they win, one of their dishes could be on the menu at The Olympic Feast.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets his new vegetable garden underway by making raised beds. He also offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of the death of William Shakespeare when he investigates the fact and the fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons, at the Chelsea Physic Garden; and we visit Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of over 25,000 tulips.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Tracey and Rob's Newport home has it all: dangerous sloped banks, a multi-level space full of wild weeds, overgrown hedges and too many trees. For those brave enough to make it to the top, however, the garden offers a magnificent view.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don uncovers the extraordinary stories behind Britains seventeenth century gardens.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don arrives in the eighteenth century, an age that gave rise to the landscape garden.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty visits influential gardens of the 19th Century, from royal retreats to the very first public parks.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the growing season picks up a pace, Monty is sowing vegetables and planting out the scented plants, which he brought back from the Malvern Spring Festival. Carol is delving into the hedgerows and rooting at the bases of walls, fences and trees as she begins her journey to investigate why plants thrive in challenging conditions. We also return to Sissinghurst to find out about the changes Troy Scott-Smith is making to the world famous white garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As summer gets into full swing, there is plenty for Monty to be doing at Longmeadow. He gets to grips with summer pruning as he tackles his espaliered pear trees. Nature's bounty is very much in evidence at Lord Rothschild's garden at Waddesdon Manor, where we get an exclusive look behind the scenes. Also, Joe Swift ponders ways of putting a contemporary twist on traditional bedding plants.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty helps two families create dream gardens that are as much for the children as for the adults. In Doncaster, Nikki and John want a garden full of edible plants and fruit.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty faces some of the most surprising plans yet - a Norwegian garden complete with waterfalls to be fashioned out of a tiny back yard in Dorset, and nothing less than a Japanese tea garden to be created out of a patch of ground in Bromley.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: The Autistic Gardener
programme.desc: The team of talented gardeners are in Ashbourne, Derbyshire, where they tackle the overgrown wilderness of Ben and Rebecca's garden. Will the autistic gardener and his crew have the ability to transform the garden and deliver on budget and on time?

programme.title: The Autistic Gardener
programme.desc: The team are in Ealing, west London, where they've taken on a small garden with a big problem. James and Sophie's neglected plot is only eight by four metres and is on two levels with a 1 metre drop. Can the team make such a tiny garden look bigger?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Now that birds are no longer nesting in hedges, now is the time to get them looking trim and neat and Monty has plenty of tips on how to cut them so that they grow well. Alan Power visits Croome Park in Worcestershire to discover more about one of the first great landscapes of Capability Brown and we visit a couple in Gloucestershire whose ornamental grass garden was inspired by the Far East.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the bank holiday ahead there's plenty of opportunity to catch up with some essential jobs in the garden and Monty gives a masterclass on how to look after and prune soft fruit to ensure maximum production next year. Frances Tophill is at RHS Rosemoor where she is catching up on her vegetable trials which she started earlier in the year, and Alan Power visits Hestercombe Gardens in Somerset to find out more about the discovery of a long lost gladiolus.
