programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "For our second episode of Huckberry Homes, we set our sights on the Oregon coast and flew out to see our friends @ben_moon and Sophie Kuller. Tired of fixing up other people's houses, Ben decided to spend the last few years crafting his own house from the ground up, while getting help from his friends, Dad, and Sophie along the way. This one-of-a-kind home now serves as a gathering place for creatives and surfers alike, nestled between the forest and Oregon coast.On Huckberry Homes, well be tapping into the most inspiring members of the Huckberry community to offer an inside peek into how theyve crafted the place they call home. We will showcase everything from cold plunges to vinyl listening rooms, home gyms and offices, and other tools that inspire creativity and high-performing lives.We would like to take a moment to acknowledge the Indigenous peoples who have stewarded the land on which this video was created. This area was the home to the Nestucca peoples and other coastal tribes until the mid-1800s when the population was decimated by diseases from settlers. Those who remained were coerced into a coastal reservation by the US government. Let us remember the histories and cultures that have shaped this land."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this episode of Huckberry Homes, we caught our good friend and photographer James Barkman out in the wild. He gave us a tour of his vintage ""Yellow Submarine"" inspired VW Van and broke down some of the modifications he has made to make this adventure bus feel more like home.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "In this episode of Huckberry Homes, we traveled down to Jacksonville, Florida to meet up with longtime friend, GORUCK Co-founder, and former Special Forces Green Beret Jason McCarthy. When hes not rucking to and from the GORUCK HQ, you can find him and his friends putting on grueling garage workouts that are the talk of the neighborhood. Huckberry and GORUCK go way back, weve shared plenty of good times, GORUCK Challenges, and (more than) a few beers along the way. Their military-grade lineup is designed to be taken to hell and back in the field. So whether youre traveling the world or embracing the suck with a 30 LB plate in your rucksack, you can be sure your gears up to the challenge."

programme.title: Gear Lab
programme.desc: Embracing passion. Devotion to craft. Never being in a rush. Thats the ethos of Maana, a surf and apparel company based right here in Austin, Texas. Our friend and Maana Founder Alec stopped by the Huckberry Gear Lab to show us some of the tools he uses everyday while hand shaping surfboards.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "In this special edition episode of Huckberry Homes, we travel to New York to get a rare look inside The Explorers Club headquarters. For the last 120 years, The Explorers Club has been the exclusive epicenter where legendary explorers come together to share some of the most incredible adventure stories ever told. From Roald Amundsens 1911 voyage to the South Pole to Sir Edmund Hillarys ascent to the summit of Mount Everest to astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrins history-changing 1969 expedition to the moon, the halls of this institution have echoed with tales of daring discovery and unparalleled human achievement. Thats why were beyond stoked to kick off our Huckberry x The Explorers Club partnershipfeaturing the Land, Sea, and Space Collection from an exclusive Whiskey Peaks collab and a badass grand prize. Tune in now to watch a tour so exclusive, its almost like being inducted into the club itself (minus the secret handshake)."

programme.title: Gear Lab
programme.desc: Our friend and host of DIRT, Josh Rosen, stopped by the Gear Lab to show us what he packed for our most recent DIRT episode in Alaska.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this special edition of Huckberry Homes, we explore Floki Studios. Floki Studios is a renowned recording studio nestled in the rugged seaside of Iceland, offering artists an unparalleled environment for creativity and collaboration. Situated on the fringes of the Arctic Circle, this sanctuary provides a haven far removed from the bustling distractions of urban life. Surrounded by the untouched beauty of Iceland's pristine nature, Floki Studios is more than just a recording space; it's a haven designed to inspire and enhance the creative journey.Behind the scenes, Floki Studios thrives thanks to a dedicated team, deeply committed to the art of music. Jay Sweet, the Music Ambassador, stands out for his passion and advocacy for artists, embodying the studio's ethos of nurturing creativity. This partnership between Jay and the Floki Studios team exemplifies a unique blend of individual dedication and collective effort, providing artists with a space that fosters creative freedom and collaboration."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "In this episode of Huckberry Homes, we traveled down to Jacksonville, Florida to meet up with longtime friend, GORUCK Co-founder, and former Special Forces Green Beret Jason McCarthy. When hes not rucking to and from the GORUCK HQ, you can find him and his friends putting on grueling garage workouts that are the talk of the neighborhood. Huckberry and GORUCK go way back, weve shared plenty of good times, GORUCK Challenges, and (more than) a few beers along the way. Their military-grade lineup is designed to be taken to hell and back in the field. So whether youre traveling the world or embracing the suck with a 30 LB plate in your rucksack, you can be sure your gears up to the challenge."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this episode of Huckberry Homes, we drove out the Texas Hill Country to see our good friend Cameron Duddy. When hes not touring around the world with his band Midland, you can find him out on his ranch, deep in the heart of Texas. Cameron gave us the lay of the land, showing us everything from a creative oasis he calls an office, to the places he enjoys most with family and friends.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This is the story of how FE Hill ranch got it's start. From its inception, FE Hill has created opportunities for people to experience the outdoors and create memories. For us, it has created a tradition of Fathers and Sons hunting together.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Texas is the home to many exotic species that can be hunted. One species in particular, Axis, have a very large population. Our team got together and had a great time hanging out with a land owner and hunting Axis deer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: From time to time you have moments that will change the way think about something. That is what happened for us while hunting the Scimitar Oryx with Republic Outdoors. Hunting is more than harvesting animals, its conservation, and in this story, we learn how a species nearly extinct gets another chance to live.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This spring, our crew was able to dive into some turkey hunting at the G2 ranch with long time TTHA Members Mike Reeber and Dan Marcasol. After a slow start, the crew was finally able to connect on a great Rio Tom and a few hogs. Learning and sharing the stories of TTHA members is something we strive to do each year.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: The Texas Gulf Coast offers an array of opportunities to experience the outdoors. From fishing to waterfowl, we have found that every hunt gives us a chance to experience other people's stories. On this hunt, we learned not only about the incredible adventures that take place at Run-N-Gun, but also about a Texas based organization changing the lives of young people.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: The bond between and parent and child can grow in many ways, but nothing compares to the bond shared when hunting. The annual Father-Son hunt at FE Hill Outfitters has becoming a tradition for Heath and his son Gavin and in 2021, Gavin was able to take his largest buck to date, with his dad Heath behind the camera.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week our team visits The Rocky Creek Ranch with two long time supporters of TTHA, Blake Barnett and John Fink. The goal in this episode is white management, which is something both Blake and John are passionate about. Blake has been hunting many years but what takes place in this hunt is a first.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week our team visits the G2 Ranch along with life time TTHA member Owen West. Owen has been a member and volunteer for Texas Trophy Hunters for 46 years and was invited to share camp with us. It was a hunt he never dreamed would happen in his lifetime.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Every year, hunters from across the country flock to various parts of Texas to extend their hunting season. This year, our friends from Struttinbuck did just the same. Matt and Clede make the long drive to Del Rio to hunt South Texas bucks right on the Mexico border.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his familys traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, hell meet plenty of farmers and foragersharvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. Thats where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredientsfrom sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintans kitchen.

programme.title: Bearded Buck
programme.desc: In this episode, Jerry and Austin are still in Nebraska hunting whitetails and muleys. After Jerry filled the first mule deer tag of the trip, the weather takes a turn for the worst and the deer movement slows down drastically. With just five days left in the trip to come up with a new game plan to figure out these whitetails and Austin's number one target mule deer, Jerry and Austin are worried that they may leave without filling another tag.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Managing a healthy deer herd is part of being a responsible hunter. Stephen, Candice, and Cliff take on the challenge of herd management by focusing on does. Its not just about the huntits about preserving the future. Join them on this important mission and see how its done.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Cliffs hard work managing a farm with the landowner finally pays off with a big Kentucky whitetail in his sights. This hunt is more than just a trophyits the result of years of dedication. See the hunt that proves patience pays off, and feel the rush of success yourself!

programme.title: Straight Up Fishing

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to the Bay Flats Lodge in Seadrift Texas to fish the vast shallow water marshes of the San Antonio Bay for Redfish. With thousands of acres of lowland creeks and pools to explore, this premier lodge has the tools and techniques it takes to get the guys their shots at this skinny water species.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to Merritt Island, the sleepy space coast town where Ali was first introduced to fishing in Florida. Hoping to partake in a specialized fishery termed "fishing the other side," the guys will need calm weather, a serious boat, and a capable crew if they are going to have a shot at the yellowfin tuna that cruise the edge of the gulf stream current 100 plus miles off the coast.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by marine scientist Nick Castillo to search for bonefish in Key Largo for both fun and study.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head offshore to the Marathon Hump, taking advantage of the 26-feet hybrid boat's versatility to find some exciting Blackfin and Skipjack Tuna fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by scientist Nick Haddad, who educates our hosts and the fishing world on the various descending devices used to preserve stressed catch from deeper waters as the three of them get into some fun Red Snapper fishing off the coast of Marathon, Florida in the Keys.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Rich's son Reed, who takes the wheel and directs the team into some amazing early morning baby tarpon fishing in the Everglades.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Witness a truly epic day on the water when Capt. Justin and Meredith find a secluded slice of beach teeming with redfish biting virtually everything. Topwater plugs, rusty flies and a live well full of bait make for an experience no redfish angler would forget

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When your gut tells you to do something different than whats in front of you, do you listen?Capt. Justin and Meredith listen, and find that success comes in many forms. And it turns out that success can be really tasty, too!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Its opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexicos most popular fish?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Theres nothing like a change in weather conditions to wreck a perfectly good fishing plan, and thats exactly what Capt. Justin Leake and his cousin encounter when December turns unseasonably warm. Its a grey morning with thick fog so Justin and Capt. Brent Berry wont be heading offshore right away as planned. Instead, Justin turns to his Humminbird CoastMaster charts to pinpoint a near shore artificial reef just five minutes from the St. Andrews Pass, where the anglers will do a little fishing until the fog burns off. Capt. Leake opts to send a jig to the bottom and hes not very picky about the one that gets tied on. When fishing reefs, the specific jig doesnt matter because its all about the presentation, he says. When youre sitting on top of a wreck, break out the junk jigs they get bit just fine. And that proves to be the case as Justin and Brent enjoy non-stop battles against amberjack, red snapper and bonita. And with a bite this good, theres no reason to go anywhere else! Also, we take a look at the United States Coast Guard Auxiliarys new paddle craft safety initiative.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We return to the Ellie B and head a hundred miles offshore to repeat last years epic tuna bite. But someone must have brought a banana on board because the plan suddenly turned into an unexpected adventure.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "For our second episode of Huckberry Homes, we set our sights on the Oregon coast and flew out to see our friends @ben_moon and Sophie Kuller. Tired of fixing up other people's houses, Ben decided to spend the last few years crafting his own house from the ground up, while getting help from his friends, Dad, and Sophie along the way. This one-of-a-kind home now serves as a gathering place for creatives and surfers alike, nestled between the forest and Oregon coast.On Huckberry Homes, well be tapping into the most inspiring members of the Huckberry community to offer an inside peek into how theyve crafted the place they call home. We will showcase everything from cold plunges to vinyl listening rooms, home gyms and offices, and other tools that inspire creativity and high-performing lives.We would like to take a moment to acknowledge the Indigenous peoples who have stewarded the land on which this video was created. This area was the home to the Nestucca peoples and other coastal tribes until the mid-1800s when the population was decimated by diseases from settlers. Those who remained were coerced into a coastal reservation by the US government. Let us remember the histories and cultures that have shaped this land."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this episode of Huckberry Homes, we caught our good friend and photographer James Barkman out in the wild. He gave us a tour of his vintage ""Yellow Submarine"" inspired VW Van and broke down some of the modifications he has made to make this adventure bus feel more like home.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "In this episode of Huckberry Homes, we traveled down to Jacksonville, Florida to meet up with longtime friend, GORUCK Co-founder, and former Special Forces Green Beret Jason McCarthy. When hes not rucking to and from the GORUCK HQ, you can find him and his friends putting on grueling garage workouts that are the talk of the neighborhood. Huckberry and GORUCK go way back, weve shared plenty of good times, GORUCK Challenges, and (more than) a few beers along the way. Their military-grade lineup is designed to be taken to hell and back in the field. So whether youre traveling the world or embracing the suck with a 30 LB plate in your rucksack, you can be sure your gears up to the challenge."

programme.title: Gear Lab
programme.desc: Embracing passion. Devotion to craft. Never being in a rush. Thats the ethos of Maana, a surf and apparel company based right here in Austin, Texas. Our friend and Maana Founder Alec stopped by the Huckberry Gear Lab to show us some of the tools he uses everyday while hand shaping surfboards.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "In this special edition episode of Huckberry Homes, we travel to New York to get a rare look inside The Explorers Club headquarters. For the last 120 years, The Explorers Club has been the exclusive epicenter where legendary explorers come together to share some of the most incredible adventure stories ever told. From Roald Amundsens 1911 voyage to the South Pole to Sir Edmund Hillarys ascent to the summit of Mount Everest to astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrins history-changing 1969 expedition to the moon, the halls of this institution have echoed with tales of daring discovery and unparalleled human achievement. Thats why were beyond stoked to kick off our Huckberry x The Explorers Club partnershipfeaturing the Land, Sea, and Space Collection from an exclusive Whiskey Peaks collab and a badass grand prize. Tune in now to watch a tour so exclusive, its almost like being inducted into the club itself (minus the secret handshake)."

programme.title: Gear Lab
programme.desc: Our friend and host of DIRT, Josh Rosen, stopped by the Gear Lab to show us what he packed for our most recent DIRT episode in Alaska.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this special edition of Huckberry Homes, we explore Floki Studios. Floki Studios is a renowned recording studio nestled in the rugged seaside of Iceland, offering artists an unparalleled environment for creativity and collaboration. Situated on the fringes of the Arctic Circle, this sanctuary provides a haven far removed from the bustling distractions of urban life. Surrounded by the untouched beauty of Iceland's pristine nature, Floki Studios is more than just a recording space; it's a haven designed to inspire and enhance the creative journey.Behind the scenes, Floki Studios thrives thanks to a dedicated team, deeply committed to the art of music. Jay Sweet, the Music Ambassador, stands out for his passion and advocacy for artists, embodying the studio's ethos of nurturing creativity. This partnership between Jay and the Floki Studios team exemplifies a unique blend of individual dedication and collective effort, providing artists with a space that fosters creative freedom and collaboration."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "In this episode of Huckberry Homes, we traveled down to Jacksonville, Florida to meet up with longtime friend, GORUCK Co-founder, and former Special Forces Green Beret Jason McCarthy. When hes not rucking to and from the GORUCK HQ, you can find him and his friends putting on grueling garage workouts that are the talk of the neighborhood. Huckberry and GORUCK go way back, weve shared plenty of good times, GORUCK Challenges, and (more than) a few beers along the way. Their military-grade lineup is designed to be taken to hell and back in the field. So whether youre traveling the world or embracing the suck with a 30 LB plate in your rucksack, you can be sure your gears up to the challenge."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this episode of Huckberry Homes, we drove out the Texas Hill Country to see our good friend Cameron Duddy. When hes not touring around the world with his band Midland, you can find him out on his ranch, deep in the heart of Texas. Cameron gave us the lay of the land, showing us everything from a creative oasis he calls an office, to the places he enjoys most with family and friends.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This is the story of how FE Hill ranch got it's start. From its inception, FE Hill has created opportunities for people to experience the outdoors and create memories. For us, it has created a tradition of Fathers and Sons hunting together.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Texas is the home to many exotic species that can be hunted. One species in particular, Axis, have a very large population. Our team got together and had a great time hanging out with a land owner and hunting Axis deer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: From time to time you have moments that will change the way think about something. That is what happened for us while hunting the Scimitar Oryx with Republic Outdoors. Hunting is more than harvesting animals, its conservation, and in this story, we learn how a species nearly extinct gets another chance to live.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This spring, our crew was able to dive into some turkey hunting at the G2 ranch with long time TTHA Members Mike Reeber and Dan Marcasol. After a slow start, the crew was finally able to connect on a great Rio Tom and a few hogs. Learning and sharing the stories of TTHA members is something we strive to do each year.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: The Texas Gulf Coast offers an array of opportunities to experience the outdoors. From fishing to waterfowl, we have found that every hunt gives us a chance to experience other people's stories. On this hunt, we learned not only about the incredible adventures that take place at Run-N-Gun, but also about a Texas based organization changing the lives of young people.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: The bond between and parent and child can grow in many ways, but nothing compares to the bond shared when hunting. The annual Father-Son hunt at FE Hill Outfitters has becoming a tradition for Heath and his son Gavin and in 2021, Gavin was able to take his largest buck to date, with his dad Heath behind the camera.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week our team visits The Rocky Creek Ranch with two long time supporters of TTHA, Blake Barnett and John Fink. The goal in this episode is white management, which is something both Blake and John are passionate about. Blake has been hunting many years but what takes place in this hunt is a first.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week our team visits the G2 Ranch along with life time TTHA member Owen West. Owen has been a member and volunteer for Texas Trophy Hunters for 46 years and was invited to share camp with us. It was a hunt he never dreamed would happen in his lifetime.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Every year, hunters from across the country flock to various parts of Texas to extend their hunting season. This year, our friends from Struttinbuck did just the same. Matt and Clede make the long drive to Del Rio to hunt South Texas bucks right on the Mexico border.

programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his familys traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, hell meet plenty of farmers and foragersharvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. Thats where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredientsfrom sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintans kitchen.

programme.title: Bearded Buck
programme.desc: In this episode, Jerry and Austin are still in Nebraska hunting whitetails and muleys. After Jerry filled the first mule deer tag of the trip, the weather takes a turn for the worst and the deer movement slows down drastically. With just five days left in the trip to come up with a new game plan to figure out these whitetails and Austin's number one target mule deer, Jerry and Austin are worried that they may leave without filling another tag.

programme.desc: Witness a truly epic day on the water when Capt. Justin and Meredith find a secluded slice of beach teeming with redfish biting virtually everything. Topwater plugs, rusty flies and a live well full of bait make for an experience no redfish angler would forget

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When your gut tells you to do something different than whats in front of you, do you listen?Capt. Justin and Meredith listen, and find that success comes in many forms. And it turns out that success can be really tasty, too!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Its opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexicos most popular fish?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Theres nothing like a change in weather conditions to wreck a perfectly good fishing plan, and thats exactly what Capt. Justin Leake and his cousin encounter when December turns unseasonably warm. Its a grey morning with thick fog so Justin and Capt. Brent Berry wont be heading offshore right away as planned. Instead, Justin turns to his Humminbird CoastMaster charts to pinpoint a near shore artificial reef just five minutes from the St. Andrews Pass, where the anglers will do a little fishing until the fog burns off. Capt. Leake opts to send a jig to the bottom and hes not very picky about the one that gets tied on. When fishing reefs, the specific jig doesnt matter because its all about the presentation, he says. When youre sitting on top of a wreck, break out the junk jigs they get bit just fine. And that proves to be the case as Justin and Brent enjoy non-stop battles against amberjack, red snapper and bonita. And with a bite this good, theres no reason to go anywhere else! Also, we take a look at the United States Coast Guard Auxiliarys new paddle craft safety initiative.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We return to the Ellie B and head a hundred miles offshore to repeat last years epic tuna bite. But someone must have brought a banana on board because the plan suddenly turned into an unexpected adventure.

programme.desc: A professional smuggler gets involved in a scheme by two half-brothers to steal a fortune from their wealthy fathers yacht in the Mediterranean.

programme.title: You Belong to Me
programme.desc: Rich playboy Peter Kirk (Henry Fonda) crashes into Dr. Helen Hunt (Barbara Stanwyck) on a ski slope and overplays his injuries so she will continue her medical attention. He declares his love, and, although Helen insists that her career will always come first, the two get married. Soon, Peter is consumed by jealous suspicions of his wife's male patients and embarrasses Helen several times. Fearful of driving her away, Peter launches into character-changing behavior to prove his love.

programme.title: The Wrecking Crew
programme.desc: Superspy, Matt Helm, with the help of agent Freya Carlson, travels to Denmark to find the mastermind behind the heist of a billion in US gold bullion.

programme.desc: A businesswoman (Evelyn Keyes) asks a bachelor (Glenn Ford) to help her find a husband so she can adopt an orphan.

programme.title: A Raisin in the Sun
programme.desc: Sidney Poitier stars in this iconic version of the famous play about a cash poor family who start to fray when they inherit a life insurance payout.

programme.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: A daughter visits her family to introduce them to her Black fianc, whose kindness and loving demeanor changes the hearts of her reluctant parents.

programme.title: Shopworn
programme.desc: After her release from a three-month prison sentence, Kitty Lane becomes an overnight musical sensation and renews her romance with David Livingston.

programme.desc: A bus trip for the girls of St. Francis Academy in Pennsylvania takes a radical detour on its way to an interfaith youth rally in California.

programme.desc: An Irish immigrant who found a home in the Army as a West Point instructor becomes very close to his pupils, one of whom is Dwight Eisenhower.

programme.desc: A divorced couple hopes to move on after their split, but fate has other plans. Theyre dating other people, but they keep running into each other!

programme.desc: Bored with his marriage, a movie producer has an affair with a temperamental actress. When she ends up murdered, all clues point to him as the killer.

programme.title: Sahara
programme.desc: A stranded group of six Allied soldiers trek across the desert, making their way to an abandoned fort, but are soon faced with a German battalion.

programme.title: Under the Yum-Yum Tree
programme.desc: The machinations of a lusty landlord threaten the bliss of a couple trying to determine their character compatibility by living together platonically.

programme.title: Meet the Stewarts
programme.desc: When a boy from modest means marries his rich, pampered finac, squabbles over budget threaten to tear the lovebirds apart in this charming rom-com.

programme.title: Don't Raise the Bridge, Lower the River
programme.desc: A daydreamer enlists the help of his British con artist friend to steal and sell the plans for a valuable new oil drill in this spy thriller spoof.

programme.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: A daughter visits her family to introduce them to her Black fianc, whose kindness and loving demeanor changes the hearts of her reluctant parents.

programme.title: J.W. Coop
programme.desc: After spending a decade behind bars for writing bad checks and punching a cop, former rodeo star J.W. Coop (Cliff Robertson) re-enters a world drastically different from how he left it; the only constant seems to be his mother (Geraldine Page). Gradually coming to terms with societal changes and cultural norms, Coop is determined to climb back to the top spot on the rodeo circuit. Along the way, he hooks up with Bean (Cristina Ferrare), a liberated woman who helps him catch up to modern life.

programme.title: The Stranger Wore a Gun
programme.desc: After the Civil War, a spy for the Confederacy absconds to Arizona to start a new life but gets reluctantly pulled into a stagecoach gold robbery.

programme.title: Riders of the Northwest Mounted
programme.desc: A Mountie (Russell Hayden) and his partner (Dub Taylor) set out on a manhunt.

programme.title: Gunmen From Laredo
programme.desc: A framed Texas rancher (Robert Knapp) escapes from prison for a showdown with a saloonkeeper (Walter Coy).

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: Former Union soldier John Parrish (Glenn Ford) wants to sell his ranch and start a new life by settling down out east. However, the ruthless tactics of Lew Wilkison (Edward G. Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: Texan and U.S. Cavalryman Lt. Frank Hewitt (Audie Murphy) deserts the army after Colorado Union soldiers carry out the deadly Sand Creek reservation massacre, fearing reprisal from the Cheyenne. Crossing into Texas, Franks finds himself labeled a traitor for fighting with the Yankees, and his warnings about possible Indian revenge go unheeded. When a town near a mission, populated mostly by women, is attacked, Frank is appointed their protector and must build an army comprised of townswomen.

programme.title: The Man From Laramie
programme.desc: Will Lockhart (James Stewart) comes to the ranch town of Coronado looking for the man who is selling rifles to the Apaches, because his brother was killed with one. There he runs into Alec Waggoman (Donald Crisp), an aging rancher with a violent son named Dave (Alex Nicol). A conflict between Dave and Vic (Arthur Kennedy), Waggoman's top aid, helps Lockhart uncover the source of the rifles -- and also gets him involved in the power struggles at the Waggoman ranch.

programme.title: They Rode West
programme.desc: Dr. Allen Seward (Robert Francis) is the new doctor at a remote Army outpost. His liberal attitudes towards Native Americans become a source of tension between him and his superiors, especially Capt. Peter Blake (Philip Carey), who regards all Native Americans as dangerous and untrustworthy. Seward's insistence on treating several local Kiowa tribespeople for malaria further enrages Blake, who deems Seward a traitor when the Kiowa join forces with the Comanches and attack the fort.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders
programme.desc: Two brothers return home after the Civil War to find that their family has been kidnapped by a marauding band of rebel Confederate guerrillas.

programme.title: Fools' Parade
programme.desc: The year is 1935, and James Stewart has been released from prison after serving a 40-year sentence. He wants nothing more than to claim the $25,000 waiting for him in a local bank, but the president of the bank doesn't want him to have it.

programme.title: Coroner Creek
programme.desc: A gunfighter (Randolph Scott) loses his beloved in a robbery and hunts the man (George Macready) to blame, who is living off the loot.

programme.title: The Desperadoes
programme.desc: Sheriff Steve Upton (Randolph Scott) is a devoted lawman who works tirelessly to keep order in his small town, nestled within the Utah territory. So, when Cheyenne Rogers (Glenn Ford), an old friend with a criminal past, rolls into town, Upton is immediately on edge. Cheyenne assures his pal that all that's behind him now. But when the town bank is robbed, Cheyenne becomes the locals' number one suspect. He'll have to prove his innocence to save himself and his friend's reputation.

programme.title: Oklahoma Crude
programme.desc: An oil derrick owner in early 1900s Oklahoma, along with her father and a bum, tries her best to keep oil companies from buying her estate.

programme.title: Return of the Durango Kid

programme.title: Up the MacGregors
programme.desc: Gregor MacGregor (David Bailey) is celebrating his upcoming marriage to Rosita Carson (Agata Flori) when bandits, led by the evil Maldonado (Leo Anchriz), steal the family fortune. Determined to get their money back, Gregor and his six brothers go after the robbers. They run across a dentist and his beautiful daughter, who help them find the gang's hideout and retrieve their cash -- but then Maldonado takes Rosita hostage in retaliation. When Gregor comes to save her, he is also captured.

programme.title: The Nevadan
programme.desc: After fleeing a sheriff's escort to jail, an outlaw thief crosses paths with a mysterious stranger and a greedy rancher en route to his stash of gold.

programme.title: Arizona Raiders

programme.title: Hands Across the Rockies
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok and his sidekick Cannonball meet a woman who is scheduled to marry the murderer they are trailing.

programme.title: Al Jennings of Oklahoma
programme.desc: Lawyer Al (Dan Duryea) and brother Frank (Dick Foran) turn to robbing banks and trains after Union troops raid their home.

programme.title: Texas
programme.desc: Confederate soldiers Dan (William Holden) and Tod (Glenn Ford) look to Texas for opportunities when the war ends. Upon witnessing a stagecoach robbery, the close friends ambush the outlaws and confiscate the stolen funds. Tod wishes to return the money, but Dan wants to keep it. After a sheriff gives chase, each man runs off on his own. They are reunited after some time, but with Tod now an honest ranch hand and Dan an outlaw cattle rustler, the two do not know if their friendship can survive.

programme.title: The Outlaw Stallion
programme.desc: A boy and his mother are kidnapped by outlaws after the boy's stallion kills the outlaw leader's mount.

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: California-bound rancher Ben Warren (Rock Hudson) is shot and left for dead when a demented ex-Confederate, Frank Slayton (Phil Carey), kidnaps his Southern bride-to-be (Donna Reed). Revived, Ben sets out to rescue her. Along the way, he picks up Jess Burgess (Leo Gordon), a slighted former member of Slayton's gang, and American Indian local Johash (Pat Hogan), who has his own beef with the outlaws. Together they embark on a perilous chase toward the Mexican border to stop Slayton.

programme.title: The Nebraskan
programme.desc: When his Indian assistant, Wingfoot (Maurice Jara), is accused of murdering a Sioux chief, Army scout Wade Harper (Phil Carey) brings him to Fort Kearney, Neb., where Colonel Markham (Regis Toomey) insists the young man has the right to a fair trial rather than handing him over to the Sioux. While in jail, Wingfoot is forced to escape with ruthless prisoner Reno Benton (Lee Van Cleef). Wade sets out with a small party to rescue his friend, with the Sioux right behind him.

programme.desc: Racial tensions rise in New Orleans when a white officer shoots a black Navy officer he believed was armed in the middle of a busy street party.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When a tutor who works with privileged students turns up dead, the team sifts through possible murderers; Bones wants to voice her own audiobook.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of a golfer-turned-lumberjack reveals numerous secrets that could have led to the victim's demise, including an affair with a married rival.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Corpses that are linked to Booth's former Army unit turn up around D.C.; Brennan's father hides a serious medical procedure from her.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A recent loss creates tension between Booth and Brennan as they each try to deal with their grief; an old flame from Brennan's past visits.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth, Brennan and Aubrey go under cover at a rowdy demolition derby to investigate the case of a young man who died in a horrendous hay baler accident; Dr. Gordon Wyatt returns and assists Hodgins and Cam when the Gormogon case hits a dead end.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The burning body of an aspiring writer and director crash-lands onto a passing car; Bones seeks guidance on the meaning of passion in the workplace; Booth allows Aubrey to take the reins on their current case.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan testifies for Zach; Angela reveals some big news; Aubrey and Jessica come to terms about their future; when the team learns Kovac has escaped, Booth rushes to protect those he loves.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: After Brennan experiences a setback, the rest of the team must continue the hunt for Kovac without her, putting everything she has ever taught them to the test.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Skeletal remains found at the bottom of a lake turn out to be those of a congressman's former aide.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When Dr. Brennan uncovers the identity of a man killed while driving a car registered to a prominent Middle Eastern man with ties to the U.S. government, she and Booth find themselves tracking a terrorist.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Dave Cutler, Goodman's Land's amorous postman, is found almost decapitated near the common early one morning. Newspaper girl Holly Reid (Kate Maberly) tells Barnaby that she heard music playing faintly nearby. Barnaby and Troy are aided in their investigations by local WPC Jay Nash (Gillian Kearney).

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The unveiling of a newly-discovered novel by deceased Midsomer crime-writer George Summersbee at the Luxton Deeping Crime Festival is jeopardised when the manuscript is stolen and a woman is fatally electrocuted by a booby-trapped roulette wheel. Can new dad Barnaby untangle a web of jealousy and obsession to find the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a pub landlady is crushed to death during a magic show in Midsomer Oaks, Barnaby and Nelson uncover conflict between the village church and ancient pagan traditions. Is famous magician Gideon Latimer to blame or is he the target?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Could a ballad made famous by late, lamented folk singer Johnny Carver be an inspiration for murder? Did someone want to kill Toby Winning for threatening to take the Little Crosby Folk Festival away from Midsomer - or is the true motive something hidden for 20 years?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The fizz goes out of a sparkling wine launch when the glasses are laced with slug poison. Who is targeting the Midsomer Vinae Winery and what does the attack have to do with the death of a child in a hit-and-run accident?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When MATTHEW DRAPER, a quarry worker is killed by a demolition charge after obeying the orders of his foreman, IAN FRASER, to return to the unexploded device, no one can predict how it might effect the tranquil village of Fletcher's Cross nine years later...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby's aunt, Alice Bly (Phyllis Calvert), has an addiction to detective stories, a deep admiration for her favourite nephew, and is recovering from an operation at the Lawnside Nursing Home. When a resident dies, Alice Bly picks up gossip which, mixed with the detective fiction with which she is passing the hours, makes her think that all is not as it should be at Lawnside.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The village of Midsomer Mallow is one of the villages hoping to win the title of the "Perfect English Village" competition. As the story unfolds, not everything is "perfect" as local thief Peter Drinkwater is stabbed with a pitchfork at an abandoned farm, he's using as a squat. Shortly after robbing a retired actor's home. Despite the villagers' best efforts to keep the murder quiet so as to not ruin their chances in the competition, several further deaths occur eventually bringing Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby back several decades to uncover the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Whilst the Upper Marshwood hunt assemble outside the village inn, a filthy tramp-like man leaves the shop and skulks into the wood. Soon after, he hears the sound of the hunt begin and the unforgettable noise of the horses and hounds in hot pursuit of the fox. Running for cover, towards the safety of his home-made shelter, he stumbles and falls into a pit - screaming. LIZA, isolated in the disused railway carriage which constitutes her home, moves deeper into the wood having heard the scream. She finds the pit and sees the tramp lying crumpled on the ground, clearly dead. She stares at him for a moment, then turns and walks away.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Plans by Barnaby to renew his wedding vows at the church of St Michael's in Badger's Drift, are quickly put on hold when the body of Richard Bayly, a local developer, is found decapitated in his own home. The detective is left mystified as to why anyone would kill a man who had only been given weeks to live, after being recently diagnosed with a brain tumour. As he and Troy attempt to find out, they soon encounter a hotbed of corruption and property feuding occurring within the village as the body count rises and the mystery deepens.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Carla Constanza - the face of Brazil's leading cigarette brand for Monarch Tobacco - is found strangled in the infamous Strangler's Wood, Barnaby and Troy not only find themselves investigating her murder, but three identical unsolved murders of innocent girls from eight years before.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Cully's latest boyfriend, Nico, decides to shadow Troy in preparation for a TV role he recently got, but gets more hands-on experience than he expected when investigations into a slashed painting at a museum in Aspern Tallow, a 17th century portrait of Royalist Jonathan Lowrie, are overshadowed by the murder of his descendant, Marcus Lowrie. It isn't long before Barnaby and Troy, with Nico's assistance, find themselves dealing with mysterious, ghostly events, escaped criminals, and a museum trustee who has more to them than meets the eye.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Hector Bridges, a local magistrate, is infuriated when one of his geese is stolen, just as two bands of travellers arrive in Martyr Warren. Although Barnaby and Troy are called in to deal with the theft and later dissuade him from forcefully evicting the travellers from the village, they soon have a murder on their hands, when a short while later Bridges is killed with his own shotgun. It quickly transpires that many in the village had hated the magistrate, who lied, bullied, and committed many an injustice, leaving the detectives determined to find who among them had pulled the trigger after Bridges pushed them past their breaking point.

programme.title: Super Sleuths - Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Murders team opens up about their experience of working on the popular crime drama and provides insight into the overall process of bringing it to the small screen.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Causton is buzzing at the opening of a new brewery on the site of a famously cursed Abbey. But excitement turns to fear when a man is found boiled to death in one of the vats. DCI Barnaby and DS Winter are puzzled; could this really be about beer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Mahesh Sidana - butterfly collector and founding member of an elite IQ society - is found murdered, pinned to a wall in a manner akin to his treasured butterfly specimens, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter are thrust into a crime that impacts not only on their community, but internationally. With the help of an old friend, can they catch the culprit before another victim is found...?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Carver Valleys comic festival is in full swing when the village is shocked by the murder of a former supermodel. With a scathing comic shaming several villagers as the only lead, Barnaby and Winter are left trying to separate fact from fiction.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby gets to relive his former days of sporting glory when a death at the local Rugby Club sends Barnaby and Winter into a muddle of rucks, old grudges, new romances and artisanal chocolates?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is less than impressed when Sarah drags him to a family friends wedding. But things soon go from bad to worse when tragedy strikes and Barnaby is called into action to catch a murderer with an apparent penchant for local brides.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Things take a gruesome turn when Ferrabees Circus comes to town, bringing with it a chain of sinister clown sightings, threatening notes and deathly dangerous circus acts. Barnaby will have to face up to his fears in order to solve the case

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.desc: Rock Legend Alice Cooper left his prized Avanti in The Count's hands, and now, he's back to get it! Will Alice like what Danny and the crew have done?

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck when a simple paint job on a 1964 Corvette turns into a full on restoration.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck when Danny and the crew discover a truckload of unpleasant surprises hiding in a 1960 Cadillac Coupe de Ville that the client wants turned into a show car.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has wanted a Plymouth Roadrunner ever since a couple of car nuts pulled him over a few years ago, and bought his Sebring on the spot.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny acquires a '74 Ford F100 he can't wait to trick out and flip for a big profit. But after The Count falls in love with the truck and decides he wants to keep it.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny finds the perfect car- a 1966 Corvette Stingray. But can he convince the owner to let it go?

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny trusts Horny Mike to paint a Medieval mural on a '73 GMC Pick Up truck, and soon regrets his decision.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers return to Waxahachie, where Vic and his prot g Sonny Monday discover an item that leads them to Dallas Stars co-captain Jamie Benn. Ricky and Bubba take a boat to Houston.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: On one of the hottest days of summer, the buyers roll into Mesquite, Texas, where Ricky and Bubba have been burned in the past. Vic lets his prot g Sonny lose and gets taken to the mat.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction hasn't even begun in the east Texas town of Henderson before a fight breaks out among the buyers. After the smoke clears, Ricky takes a couple of rounds while Kenny gets taken to the bank.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In West Covina, Brandi makes a serious land grab, and it pays off handsomely; Rene can't resist the mystery of a good safe; Kenny can't seem to satisfy his hunger; Barry takes an opportunity to poach from the competition.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene goes big; Ivy scores a packed locker and stumbles across an antique of unusual origin; Darrell grabs a smaller unit but finds that good things do, indeed, come in petite packages sometimes.

programme.title: Storage Wars

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Lisa comes to Montebello with a clear mind, intent on letting the lockers speak to her; Ivy lets his son navigate his way to a unit which turns out not to be completely vacant; Kenny is absolutely appalled by what he finds abandoned in his unit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi is determined to actually win a locker for once in Santa Ana and has to show restraint to do it; Rene spots a stack of items in a locker that speaks to him; Kenny puts his needs out to the universe; Barry struggles to stay in the game.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy drags Isaiah to Victorville as punishment for getting Cs on his report card; Kenny wants to furnish his new house, but there are eight reasons standing in his way; not to be cheesy, but Lisa learns a lot.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi is fired up about expanding her brand in San Bernardino; Rene is positive that everyone is out to get him; Dusty tackles a locker dustier than him.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After all their hard work, Willie decides to take the entire Robertson clan on a family vacation to Hawaii.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Tomorrow is the opening day of Duck Season and the men are carrying on their tradition of camping on the Robertson Land the night before... including Willie.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Gearing up for his high school reunion, Willie realizes that he could stand to lose a few pounds. Jase and Korie set out to help him drop some weight and the strenuous battle of man-versus-waistline begins.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys learn from Willie that John Luke is going through his first break up. In order to make him feel better the men decide to take John Luke hunting for nutria, and impart their relationship wisdom.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the warehouse guys new office pet (a lizard) escapes, they try all they can in order to catch the wily reptile. Proving impossible, the guys finally decide to bring in the big guns to help trap it--Mr. Phil Robertson.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Willie out-of-town, the guys decide to flake off work and leave to brush up the duck blinds on the Robertson land. While out, Si believes he spots what he thinks is the infamous "Black Panther,"

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Jase invite Korie and Missy along on a deer hunt because they believe their wives have become too "city."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: During Duck Commander's "Casino Night" party for the sale of their 5 millionth duck call, Si Robertson wins the grand prize of $2000 and decides to buy a massage chair for the duck call room.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Sadie, has a homecoming dance coming up, but Willie doesn't approve of her dress selection. Willie decides to take Sadie out to find her a new "appropriate" dress.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Though Jase lost his wedding ring long ago, Missy decides it's time for Jase to replace it with a new one. When Jase is duck hunting, once again, he loses the ring and is forced to come up with a game plan of how to approach and appease Missy.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Duck Commander team is invited to unveil a wing of the local Bass Pro shop that will feature their products.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie calls the team into work on a Saturday afternoon for an HR training session, but the seminar quickly dissolves from unproductive to complete disaster.

programme.desc: After all their hard work, Willie decides to take the entire Robertson clan on a family vacation to Hawaii.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Everyone comes together to plan a surprise wedding for Phil and Kay, setting up a special ceremony on their land, which the whole family attends. Si distracts Phil and Kay by taking them on a "trip down memory lane" to different places.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After discovering that Martin has to miss a Friday night poker game for a planned date, the guys (as well as their wives) take turns figuring out the best way to coach him for romance.

programme.desc: The guys realize that Godwin has never really asked them for a favor, even though they are all always helping each other out.

programme.desc: Due to construction at Jase and Missy's house, Willie and Korie invite Jase and the kids to live with them while Missy is out of town visiting friends.

programme.desc: Because of a termite problem at Duck Commander, the guys are forced to find a different location to work from--Godwin's House.

programme.desc: John Luke and Sadie are getting some dental work done, complete with sedation, and it's up to Willie and Korie to take care of them through the process.

programme.desc: Si shows up to work on a mobility scooter, claiming to have an invisible injury from a fender bender with Willie. After losing her beloved turtle "Mr. T", Ms.Kay enlists Phil on a mission to find a new pet turtle.

programme.desc: A decision to try and make some duck jerky leads the boys to Godwin's garage and a minibike race. Phil and Kay have made Willie the executor of their will, and Phil wants to show Willie what he and his brothers will inherit.

programme.desc: Si discovers Youtube, and, after watching a series of instructional videos, decides he can make something better.

programme.desc: After several months in Hollywood, Abby returns to the Abby Lee Dance Company to find her dancers have been slacking off.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Spring brings a rush of warm weather and the big melt begins. The road is nearly empty as only the toughest or craziest truckers remain.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: This special will examine in depth the changes that have taken place in Yellowknife.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: On one of the coldest frontiers on the planet, the Ice Road Truckers brave treacherous terrain to deliver crucial supplies to northern diamond mines.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It is a job only a few would dare. This year, four ice road truckers, Hugh, Alex, Rick and Drew, return from last season to join Arctic veterans.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: After just two days in the Arctic, the critical demands of the oil exploration sites are testing the limits of the truckers and their machines.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Just five days into the Arctic adventure, Mother Nature is about to strike and wreak havoc on the ice roads.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's week two on the frozen tundra and the name of the game is Rig Move. MGM is breaking down camp and moving every last piece of equipment to a new base at Langley.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: After the storm clears, most of the truckers are ready to roll--all except Rick, who is on the verge of quitting and looks to Hugh for advice.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The truckers have delivered the fragile 135-foot derrick to the new MGM exploration site.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Bear and Eric must haul a boiler and a flare stack--two critical pieces of equipment.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: After being Med-Evaced to Yellowknife hospital, Alex receives a grim diagnosis that could mean the end of his Ice Road season.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Research site before the ice road melts, but while scientists are on the verge of an historic breakthrough, the truckers are starting to haul away equipment piece-by-piece.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: With the sun beating down on the ice, the road is melting at an accelerating rate.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Rising temperatures are melting away the ice road, making it a dash to the finish line for the crew breaking down the Langely site.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Warming temperatures are causing overflows all over the ice road, and with water rushing through cracks in the ice, hauling loads just got a lot more dangerous.

programme.desc: With the ice road melting at a quickening rate, the truckers reflect on their first season tackling the treacherous roads of the Arctic.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Going after two fugitives in one day is tough enough without the facing Colorado's notoriously unpredictable weather. Today it's the threat of sever thunderstorm, hail and area wide tornado warnings.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back in Hawaii and tracking a dangerous fugitive through the jungles of the Big Island. Their prey is being protected by a ring of family and friends that Dog must forcefully confront to bring in his man.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is trying to cut down on smoking, but it's not easy with his high-stress job. Today, he must track down Walter, a fugitive who believes that the Canadian military has planted a chip in his tooth.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's time is running out in Colorado. After a month of helping his bail bondsmen friends around Denver, he's got to get his family back home to Hawaii. But Dog wants one more capture before they leave.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Before Tim heads out for a tough day of bounty hunting, he likes to get in a little quality time with his daughter, Summer Rain. This morning, he takes the toddler for a spin around the yard in her little red wagon.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The co-signer on this bond is seven months pregnant, and she says that the man she bailed out has threatened her safety and has been running amok on the streets. Now Dog and the posse have got to revoke John's bail.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog pursues two people whose lives have been devastated by drugs. First, he tracks Mae, who traded a good home, loving kids, and an adoring husband for an ice pipe. He busts Mae, but is amazed to discover that her family still showers her with love.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Beth take on the heartbreaking case of Rachel. Rachel's mom bailed her out of jail on condition that she go to AA meetings and stick to a curfew.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is a rough, tough bounty hunter, but he's a softie at heart, as the two cases in this episode show. The first case involves Frankie, who's had a problem with methamphetamines.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When the team hunts for Steven, a fugitive with a history of domestic abuse, they seek help from his girlfriend, who's been a victim of his abuse. Meanwhile, Beth trains for a 5K race to help raise awareness about domestic abuse.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's latest quarry is running from abuse and assault charges. As Dog investigates, he discovers that this fugitive has gamed the system by jumping from one bond, and one bondsman, to another.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back hunting in the big city of Denver, but chasing fugitives on the mainland is more dangerous than ever. So Dog decides that the crew should get pepper-ball guns, which have much better range than pepper spray.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today the crew is hunting for Holly, a car thief. She's one of Tim's bonds and the entire Dog crew knows that means trouble--or at least a long and difficult chase.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Going after two fugitives in one day is tough enough without the facing Colorado's notoriously unpredictable weather. Today it's the threat of sever thunderstorm, hail and area wide tornado warnings.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back in Hawaii and tracking a dangerous fugitive through the jungles of the Big Island. Their prey is being protected by a ring of family and friends that Dog must forcefully confront to bring in his man.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog always wants to share the wisdom he has collected on the streets with the fugitives he captures. But today he's going to do double duty! His son-in-law Travis (and trainee bondsman) is also in need of some knowledge.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is always trying to reduce the number of fugitives in Hawaii, so he really doesn't like felons from the mainland combining their flight from the law with an island vacation.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: For Dog and Beth it's not only another day in paradise, it's their anniversary. Beth is hoping for a romantic dinner with her man, but she knows only too well that for Dog work always comes first.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog just can't resist a challenge, especially if it's to help out a friend. Jim is a bondsman and longtime friend of Dog. Jim's son has just started in the family business.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Darkness has fallen, but with the trail hot and the stakes high Dog and posse refuse to let up. The "Big Fish" in this case is Marco, an alleged drug dealer with a big bond.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's relentless ruthlessness is being put to the test on the search for the elusive fugitive, Marco. Dog is tracking him across Colorado, from Grand Junction to Denver.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Back in Colorado Dog tracks a fugitive who is on the run from the law for the first time. Reading the file Dog knows the young man's life is at the crossroads.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When a stripper goes on the lam, Dog has to bring her in--it's a tough job but somebody has to do it. Thankfully for the team, Lady Luck is presiding over the posse tonight.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There is a running joke in the posse that every time Bobby Brown asks them for help with a fugitive he always promises them that it's "an easy one," but the hunts end up being epic searches.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's target for today has been in trouble with the law since he was a juvenile. And he seems willing to use any trick in the system to avoid capture by Dog. In this match of wits, will Dog prevail?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's target for today has been in trouble with the law since he was a juvenile. And he seems willing to use any trick in the system to avoid capture by Dog. In this match of wits, will Dog prevail?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: "When you don't write the bond, you don't know the prey," as Dog always says. So when Dog and team help out a bondsman friend whose client jumped bail, the target is a blank slate. Are his tattoos gang related? Is he likely to be violent?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is tracking down Cecilia, who's wanted for aggravated car theft, but she's nowhere to be found.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Both brother Tim and fellow Honolulu bondsman James need Dog's help to track down their hard to find fugitives. The two cases on the docket today are challenging, especially the hunt for Gregory, a felon with a lengthy rap sheet.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's Beth's birthday and Dog knows just what she needs, whether she knows it or not! He surprises Beth with Delilah, a Papillion puppy small enough to sit in the palm of her hand.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Facing hard time for forging checks, Melissa pulled a vanishing act at her sentencing hearing, bolting from the courthouse in broad daylight. Lucky for her bondsman, Dog and his posse are in Colorado and ready to help.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's got a twofer on his hands, but the cases couldn't be more different. The first is a woman whose family wants her back in jail, the other is a former choirboy whose family ties are strong.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog knows that crime and drugs not only damage victims but also harm the families of the perpetrators, especially the kids. And both of the fugitives he's chasing today have left shattered families and struggling women in their wake.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What looks like a routine pick-up turns into a complicated case of betrayal, deceit, as well as quality nail care as Dog and company track down an fugitive alleged to be an abusive boyfriend with one too many friends in his close knit community.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It takes years to become a seasoned bondsman, and the tenderfoot Alysin has a lot to learn. She not only bailed out a man facing charges of theft on just his promise to pay the fee but also without a co-signer for his bond.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: So what does a bondsman do when he learns that the felon he's bonded out is booked on an afternoon flight to Florida? Especially when over $140,000 is at stake? If you're Dog, you 911 the team and race to Honolulu International.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What's a father to do? When the cops ask Dog for help tracking down a renegade teen with a history of running hard, Baby Lyssa, eight months pregnant and counting, insists on joins the hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: "When you don't write the bond, you don't know the prey," as Dog always says. So when Dog and team help out a bondsman friend whose client jumped bail, the target is a blank slate. Are his tattoos gang related? Is he likely to be violent?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's final programme is The Granary in rural Hampshire, an upmarket restaurant which - at 200 seats - is the biggest Gordon's ever taken on. Originally opened by entrepreneur Nigel Nieddu as an up-market dining club four years ago, the restaurant was relaunched after a ~2m refit, but it's still losing ~4k a week. It promises classy modern British cuisine but in reality the fussy menu features food sourced from all over the globe and the locals, disconcerted by its exclusive reputation, are staying far away. Head Chef Martin doubles as parole officer to his unruly teenage charges in the kitchen, while Nigel stubbornly struggles to contain the front-of-house chaos that he's created.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
The venue is The Runaway Girl, a tapas bar-cum-nightclub in Sheffield city centre on the brink of collapse. The restaurant is losing money by the bucket-load and the two best friends who run it are at war with each other. The owner Justin Rowntree won't listen to reason, and his head chef and best friend Ritchie has had enough. To make matters worse the credit crunch has hit and there is fierce competition from corporate chains.
Gordon is on hand to help the friend's weather the storm with a credit crunch menu solution designed to take on the chains, but can Gordon save Justin's failing business, and prevent his friendship with Ritchie ending up in tatters?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's programme is The Fish & Anchor, a restaurant and bar near Lampeter in rural West Wales, owned and run by ex-boxer Mike and his wife Caron. Mike, a self-taught cook, is a one-man pressure cooker in the kitchen as he struggles to accommodate a vast menu while Caron's unique style of front-of-house management includes abusing the customers and her husband in equal measure. Every night they go twelve rounds with the local clientele who are fast deserting them to the tune of a ~1,000 per week loss.

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay starts his culinary journey in the north of India where he cooks for 400 passengers in an express train's cramped pantry car.

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: Gordon immerses himself in the life of a local tribe in Nagaland, visits Assam to enter a housewives' competition and sets up shop on the streets of Calcutta.

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: Gordon ends his travels to India by heading south, living in an ashram in Kerala and working alongside one of India's top chefs in Mumbai.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's third programme is Momma Cherri's Soul Food Shack, an intimate forty-seater a stone's throw from Brighton's sea front. Big soul momma, owner Charita Jones, produces a menu of irresistibly unique classics from the Deep South. The food's hard to fault but the punters are nowhere to be seen, Head Chef Brian and a rag-tag collection of part-timers are taking the mickey - and despite working a seven-day week Charita's got an empty restaurant and a ~65,000 debt.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's fourth programme is La Riviera, a fine dining restaurant in Inverness. Owned by multi-millionaire Barry Larson and costing ~8000 a week to run, the place boasts top French chef Loic Lefebvre and an impeccably-trained kitchen staff with Michelin star-studded backgrounds. Loic is on a mission, to bring sophisticated French cooking to the home of haggis, tatties and deep-fried Mars bars. But though he's hungry for success, he's French, he's arrogant and the food's pretentious.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's program is Clubway 41, despite being voted Blackpool Tourist Board Restaurant of the year, the place is dire straits. It is the prime example of HOW NOT TO RUN A RESTAURANT. Owner DAVE is the flakey self-appointed head chef, who hasn't been in a kitchen for 30 years and can't cook. His partner DAWN invents bizarre dishes for the menu, ranging from "tomato and cointreau soup" to "pork with brie, nectarine and whiskey sauce". Gordon faces a hellish week, Clubway 41 is breaking every rule in book, can he bring Dave, Dawn and their food back to earth?

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Team Salvage has been commissioned to remove a giant floating pontoon that won't float but they keep running into trouble.

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Team Salvage has been tasked with back-to-back rescue missions, an underwater pipeline job and a concrete houseboat recovery from deep within the mangroves.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits West Dover in Vermont, to try to save a dog-friendly hotel thats desperately in need of help. Sandy MacDougall, the owner, runs the hotel like a hostel with unpaid staff staying in the rooms instead of paying guests.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to Murphys Historic Hotel near Sacramento in northern California, where party-boy owners Brian, Kevin and Joel are too busy drinking, partying and lap-dancing in the rowdy bar, to look after their historic hotel.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon checks in to Connecticuts oldest inn, the Curtis House. This historic inn has been run by the Hardisty family for generations, but the business has started to fall apart and the family legacy is on the brink of being lost.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's second programme is Piccolo Teatro, a bijou vegetarian restaurant in Paris run by feisty Scot Rachel. A former waitress at the restaurant, Rachel bought it three years ago and now, along with best friend Stephanie, she's trying to convert the carnivorous French into a nation of veggies. For Gordon it's a sentimental journey to the city where he spent his formative years as a chef, a food mecca full of gastronomic delights that should be a dream.

programme.desc: Two motorists are trapped in their wrecked cars after a head on crash on ice and the team face a difficult dilemma - which most needs a flight to hospital?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's first programme is La Lanterna in Letchworth, Hertfordshire. Twenty-eight-year-old owner and head chef Alex offers modern Italian cuisine, a taste of Little Italy in England's first garden city, and the restaurant is run by his best mate maitre d Gavin, helped by his ex-air hostess girlfriend Emily. But Alex has no customers, cookers that don't work and an expensive menu that's about as authentically Italian as a spag bol.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's second programme is D-Place in Chelmsford, Essex run by Mexican-born Israel and his English partner Tara. They've sunk ~150,000 of their own money into their trendy caf bar which offers a vast selection of fusion cuisine. In charge is Executive Chef Philippe, producing everything from all-day breakfasts to hoi sin noodles with an astounding lack of flair; the plastic food is dire and boomerangs back from the dining room as soon as it's cooked.
